kulami.game.board

Class GameMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • kulami.game.board.GameMap

  • public class GameMap
extends java.lang.Object
    GameMap represents a board of 17 panels together with its current configuration of marbles.
    Author:
    gordon

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameMap

        private GameMap()
        Private constructor that encapsulates general initialization tasks.

        Creates a Marbles object and sets the marbles counter for each player to 28.

    • Method Detail

      • getCopy

        public GameMap getCopy()
        Returns a copy of the GameMap.

        The returned object can be used to manipulate the game without altering the real game state.

        Returns:
        the new GameMap

      • clearOwners

        public void clearOwners()
        Set the owner of all fields to None, erase the history and reset the numbers of marbles.

      • getLegalFields

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pos> getLegalFields()
        Get all the positions where it is legal to place a marble in the next move.
        Returns:
        a list of positions.

      • isLegal

        private boolean isLegal(Pos pos)
        Returns true if it is legal to place a marble at position pos.
        Parameters:
        pos -
        Returns:
        true if pos is legal

      • getMapCode

        public java.lang.String getMapCode()
        Get a textual representation of the GameMap.

        The map code is a String of 100 pairs of characters, the first of which indicates the Panel, and the second of which indicates the Owner.

        Returns:
        the 200-character board code

      • setOwner

        public void setOwner(Pos pos,
            Owner owner)
        Set the Owner of a field.

        If the Owner changes, save the move in a history and decrease the number of available marbles.

        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the field
        owner - the new owner

      • updateGameMap

        public void updateGameMap(java.lang.String boardCode)
                   throws IllegalBoardCode
        Given a board code, update the Owners of the fields.
        Parameters:
        boardCode - 200-character board code
        Throws:
        IllegalBoardCode

      • getPanelOwners

        public java.util.List<Owner> getPanelOwners()
        Returns a List of length 100 that contains the Owner of the Panels on the corresponding fields.

        This list can be used to visualize panel possession.

        Returns:
        list of panel owners
